channel.title: IETF-relevant MDN issues
channel.description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by IETF

item.title: [rfc7232] Issue with "If-None-Match": (short summary here please)
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/If-None-Match

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

Apache reverse proxies will append "-gzip" suffix to well-formed ETag headers when gzip-encoding content, but they do not remove them from If-None-Match headers. See https://bz.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=39727

There are good reasons for this, since gzip-encoding the content will affect how range requests can be used. But server software that compares If-None-Match headers in requests with ETags may need to account for this.

Specific section or headline?

Unsure.

What did you expect to see?

It should be mentioned somewhere.

Did you test this? If so, how?

I cam across this while working on server code.

MDN Content page report details
  • Folder: en-us/web/http/headers/if-none-match
  • MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/If-None-Match
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/web/http/headers/if-none-match/index.html
  • Last commit: f6f11d2
  • Document last modified: 2021-02-19T19:33:30.000Z
